definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: Today, caskets are usually placed in above-ground-vaults, like the ones pictured here.
sentences.chinese: 现在，如图所示，棺材通常都放置在地上灵堂。

sentences.english: that he invited his guests to join him in the Hall of Ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 甚至请他的客人跟他一块到祖先的灵堂里去。

sentences.english: Women invited to join the crying in the room where the coffin was placed.
sentences.chinese: 坐在灵堂里专门请来哭丧的女人。

sentences.english: And blights with Plagues the Marriage hearse.
sentences.chinese: 带者瘟疫肆虐张狂，直把婚礼变成灵堂。

sentences.english: That, old man's house, you know, what is what to work properly an inside oblation ?
sentences.chinese: 那，老人家，你知道，灵堂里供奉的是什么吗？

definition: to offer condolences (for the deceased)/to condole
to keep watch beside a coffin
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻戴孝
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
